oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "The Agriculturist" masthead
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Agriculture
Agriculture; Periodicals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Initial issue of the "State Organ" for the Tennessee Agricultural Society finds the editors setting out their goals for this serial that is to be supported by state and county agricultural societies.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Shelby, J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The State Agricultural Society of Tennessee first met in May of 1839 and was incorporated by the General Assembly in 1842. "The Agriculturist" printed its inaugural issue in January of 1840 and debuted as the monthly journal of the Society. J. Shelby, Gerard Troost, and Tolbert Fanning served as co-editors; they were later joined by F. K. Zollicoffer. The journal was published through December of 1845. It was then absorbed by the "Southern Agriculturist."
